perturbation.original_text:
Franchisor hereby grants to Developer, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement (if
Section 2.20 is applicable add “, and specifically Section 2.20 hereof,”) and as long as Developer shall not be
in default of this Agreement or any other development, franchise or other agreement between Developer and
Franchisor, (non-exclusive/exclusive) development rights to establish and operate ____ franchised restaurant(s),
and to use the El Pollo Loco® System solely in connection therewith, at specific locations to be designated in
separate Franchise Agreement(s) (the “Franchise Agreements”).
perturbation.changed_text:
Franchisor hereby grants to Developer, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement (if
Section 2.20 is applicable add “, and specifically Section 2.20 hereof,”) and as long as Developer shall not be
in default of this Agreement or any other development, franchise or other agreement between Developer and
Franchisor, (non-exclusive/exclusive) temporary rights to establish and operate ____ franchised restaurant(s),
and to use the El Pollo Loco® System solely in connection therewith, at specific locations to be designated in
separate Franchise Agreement(s) (the “Franchise Agreements”).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'development rights' to 'temporary rights' creates a contradiction. Development rights imply long-term privileges, while 'temporary rights' introduces ambiguity and uncertainty, potentially conflicting with franchise laws that expect a clear grant of rights. Franchise law mandates certain rights and responsibilities for franchisees; describing the granted rights as 'temporary' undermines the stability and predictability expected in a franchise agreement. This creates uncertainty on the type of rights a developer receives from the development agreement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Franchise laws regarding the clarity and duration of rights granted to franchisees.

officer, director, shareholder, member, manager, partner and other equity owner, as applicable, of Developer, if
Developer is an entity, shall neither directly nor indirectly own, operate, control or any financial interest in any other
business which would constitute a “Competitive Business” (as hereinafter defined) without the prior written

perturbation.changed_text:
20.1. To further protect the El Pollo Loco® System while this Agreement is in effect, Developer and each
officer, director, shareholder, member, manager, partner and other equity owner, as applicable, of Developer, if
Developer is an entity, shall neither directly nor indirectly own, operate, control or any financial interest in any other
business which would constitute a “Similar Business” (as hereinafter defined) without the prior written
consent of Franchisor
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'Competitive Business' to 'Similar Business' introduces a conflict in the definition. The original contract defines 'Competitive Business'. Replacing it with 'Similar Business' without defining this new term introduces legal uncertainty, as 'similar' is broader and more subjective than 'competitive,' potentially capturing businesses not intended by the original non-compete clause.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles requiring clear and unambiguous definitions of key terms, particularly in restrictive covenants.

perturbation.original_text:
2.5. Developer shall use its best efforts to retain qualified real estate professionals (including licensed
brokers) to locate proposed sites for the El Pollo Loco® Restaurant(s).
perturbation.changed_text: 2.5. Developer shall use its reasonable efforts to retain any real estate professionals (including anyone claiming to be brokers) to locate proposed sites for the El Pollo Loco® Restaurant(s).
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'best efforts' to 'reasonable efforts' with the inclusion of 'anyone claiming to be brokers' causes a contradiction because the developer might not want to hire anyone that claims to be a broker. 'Best efforts' imposes a high standard of diligence, while 'reasonable efforts' implies a lower standard. Additionally, suggesting the use of unlicensed brokers contradicts real estate laws requiring licensure. This creates a conflict because the contract appears to promote a violation of the real estate laws of a given state.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Real estate laws mandating licensure for real estate brokers and agents; contract law principles requiring compliance with the law.
